review.reviewBody: Durable and easy in easy off. Tough to get brakes apart is the only negative, but the stay locked together when toting on shoulder…so a draw.

review.reviewBody:
Not happy with them! Safety movable plastic plates AFD prone to jam outside or inside the skis, during turn. 2023 Bindings mounted professionally by Salomon service on Stoeckli Stormrider 95 skis.
AFD re-greased twice by two different services with binding grease, no improvement.
Overlapping stuck plates can lead to accident and injury. Looking for recall or replacement both toe pieces.
Other Salomon ski bindings I owned like STH and Warden always worked flawlessly.
Can provide photo or video clip if requested.

review.reviewBody: This has quickly become one of my favorite accessories. It's perfect for both fall and spring riding when the temperature fluctuates. It's small enough to easily fit in a jersey pocket. The zipper is two-way so you can open it either from the top or bottom for ventilation if need be. I ordered the orange color, unlike the product photos the back is not a black mesh but similar orange material so the vest appears to be one single color (my preference to aid rear visibility). The fit is nice and snug and the fabric is stretchy, it hugs your body without any fabric flapping in the wind. I'm a tad over 6 feet tall with a slender build and weigh 168 lbs, the large size was perfect.
review.name: Perfect for shoulder season, love it.

name: Espresso Vest - Men's

hasVariant.description: Buy the Thule Chariot Internal Hub Adapter online or shop all Kids from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
Emailed support last summer in hopes to find a solution for a Thule chariot on a Cannondale Bad Boy 1 which has a Shimano Alfine internal hub.   Used all summer with my daughter without an issue!

Two bicycle shops I went to which are Thule dealers both said its not possible with my bike.   Glad I emailed support before giving up.
review.name: Works perfect

review.reviewBody:
Thule France doesn't allow to leave reviews... no wonder. I had to buy this adapter for bike. Let aside the price (It's only a nut and a bolt...). This adapter will require you to carry a 13 AND a 19 wrench, in addition to the 15 you already had to remove and repair your rear wheel in case of a puncture.
You get to carry two extra tools, because, of course, why would they have a 15 nut, or a 15 bolt, when they can make them of two different sizes.

In addition, the user manual has never been updated to include the "recently" released Shimano hubs Nexus 5-e and Nexus 5. After all, they have only been there for 4 and 11 years, respectively.
review.name: Expensive and unpractical

review.reviewBody: I tried all three hub adapters sold by Thule on my two e-bikes. None fit my threaded axles. I sent my axle specs (M12x1.25) to Thule and asked for a solution.  Their reply was that I was out of luck.  My "top-of-the-line" Thule Chariot trailer cannot be used on either of my e-bikes.  Very disappointed.
review.name: Beware: not all hub axel sizes are supported
comment:
Hello Steve,

Thank you for reaching out. I'm sorry that Thule's Internal Hub Adapters did not match your bike. Several models are available to fit a variety of bikes, we are not able to produce adapters for all hub styles available. 

I recommend reaching out to the bike manufacturer for a recommendation that matches your specific hub style, spacing, and size.

name: Chariot Internal Hub Adapter

review.reviewBody: Great EDC. Everything you need— nothing you don’t.
review.name: Fantastic Day Pack

review.reviewBody: Bought this to replace an older MR tag backpack that I recently retired. Spent a lot of time comparing packs from other well known brands and eventually came back to MR and settled on the Catalyst. Primary requirements were that I wanted similar capacity (18-21L) and needed to have padded back and laptop sleeve. This bag met both of those requirements perfectly. It holds a 16" Macbook Pro perfectly in the sleeve and has plenty of room for laptop cords and accessories, along with a layer (puffy or rain jacket) and a 32oz nalgene. I like the top zippered pocket, and don't really care that i'm missing exterior pockets/pouches for a water bottle. The Y layout for the zipper and panels looked gimmicky at first but works great for loading/unloading the pack. The shoulder straps are also very comfy and I love the oversized handle on the lid of the pack as well. My only extremely minor gripe about this pack is that the interior zippered pockets on the left and right panels are very shallow, and would have preferred them to be at least 2x the height or even full height of the panel. As they stand those pockets don't offer nearly as much utility as they could and can only accomodate smaller items. Overall very impressed with this pack and look forward to many years of service with it.
review.name: Near perfect EDC bag for office or on the town

review.reviewBody: The strongpoints of this pack are exactly what you would expect. The only thing that keeps it from being an oustanding EDC bag is the lack of bottle pockets on the exterior.
review.name: Almost great!

review.reviewBody: Well designed and  constructed, durable, easy to manage. Its a great daily carry or small med/bug out bag.
review.name: Nice little pack

name: Catalyst 18 Backpack

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Loved my Osprey Hikelite 32. I carried it on The Camino in Portugal and Spain. Perfect size and fit. I can’t say enough good things about it! The pockets , the rain cover, how easy it was to size. Love love love it.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great bag, i lose my stuff because theres so may pockets love the hip pockets. Water proof bag is so amazing
review.name: Great bag, i lose my

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] A very decent pack indeed, I mostly use it for single-day hikes when I'm going light, under 10kg. It pretty comfortably fits the necessities (first aid kit, headlight, sunglasses, emergency blanket, lighter, etc) along with 1-day worth of food and water, jetboil, coffee stuff and a couple of extra layers including puffy jacket.

What I did like: pretty spacious 32l daypack, good back and waist support, integrated rain cover, roomy and sturdy back pocket with mesh extension, upper compression straps with fastex lock.

What I didn't like: relatively small and not very comfortable lid-pocket, the waist only has one zippered pocket, the other one is useless mesh, no stow-on-the-go attachment. Generally, attaching both trekking poles or something relatively big to the sides makes opening the pack very inconvenient, these attached items get in the way of zipper. Not very high-quality zippers, my other osprey packs have better ones.

It would also be nice to have bottom straps (detachable, at least) to pack a table or sleeping pad (sometimes I take one even on day hikes).

Also - one of the really expensive ones for 32l :(
review.name: A very decent pack indeed,

review.reviewBody: I hiked across Spain for 500 miles over 35 days carrying this pack. I had NO issues and it was so comfortable. I carried about 13-15 lbs with a water bladder. Only wish the water bladder nozzle had a cover as every time I set the pack down my nozzle touched the ground - good for my immune system! I just feel so grateful for my pack. One of your sales people on the phone recommended it after I tried several other models and sizes. Couldn't be happier. One of the zippers broke before my trip but it wasn't key. I will call regarding this. Otherwise - highly recommend this pack. So light, so comfy, so kind to my body after a long haul. Thank you.
review.name: I LOVE this backpack.

review.reviewBody: I had really high hopes regarding this new design of the Hikelite 32 but am slowly losing respect for it. I purchased this bag for a day pack/carry on for a 17 Iceland vacation. This was the bags first outing and the material is already starting to wear through where the integrated frame is installed. Not only that, but the lettering/logo is already starting to wear off making it look sloppy. The bag is comfy and roomy and basic but the quality concerns me. The top loading is nice and the suspension/frame system keeps your back cool. Not sure if I'll buy another Osprey product after this trip.
review.name: Great bag, poor quality.

name: Hikelite 32L Pack

review.itemreviewed: Ether Light XT Extreme Mat - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Outdoor store employee. I've been using my regular woman's etherlight pad for a couple of years. I do a lot of winter backpacking and wanted something warmer. I'm not a tall person (male,5'7) and a side sleeper who turns alot. So the women's pads work great for me. They fit in my tent and in the back of my truck so it's super versatile. I've had to patch mine several times and it was great still. I did have to retire it recently but customer service made it super easy to replace.
review.name: Favorite sleep pad

review.itemreviewed: Ether Light XT Extreme Mat - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] It worked great. I combined it with a liner & my 20 year old cold weather sleeping bag.
review.name: Love it

review.itemreviewed: Ether Light XT Extreme Mat - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I’ve used the extreme pad twice. I highly recommend it. The first weekend was on a trip where the low was 55 and the pad plus low temp sleeping bag combo made it unbearably hot, a problem I can easily fix with my lighter weight sleeping bag next summer. The second trip was after the weather turned and the low was 15, it was cold but I did fall asleep with an appropriate sleeping bag, thermal liner and this pad. I had such a good night sleep I decided to get the attached pillow for my next winter outing.
review.name: Warmer than expected

review.itemreviewed: Ether Light XT Extreme Mat - Women's
review.reviewBody: Perfection hands down. I did not expect to sleep so comfortably on any air mattress so I am still pleasantly surprised. It is well insulated and setting it up was so much easier with the air bag. I'm a side sleeper that sleeps like a fish out of water so obviously some compromises need to be made when making this type of purchase. I am not only impressed with the pad itself but the company as well. I messed up my shipping address and they still helped me get it in time for my final shake down. Even though it was my mistake they worked with me to quickly expedite my full order without making me feel bad for screwing up. Very grateful for such a positive experience so I will be purchasing as much of my replacement gear as I can right here!! Thank you!
review.name: In Shock

review.itemreviewed: Ether Light XT Extreme Mat - Women's
review.reviewBody: I'm blown away by how much the sleeping mat technology has advanced in 10 years. Why on earth didn't I get a new sleeping mat sooner?? This sleeping mat is pretty friggin' awesome so far. Comfortable and WARM!! I love the inflation sack vs having to nearly pass out from blowing into my old sleeping mat. The second thing I love about the inflation sack is it's quicker to inflate than the old school blowing. I'm a fan so far!
review.name: Love all around, comfy, warm, easy setup/take down

name: Ether Light XT Extreme Mat - Women's

review.itemreviewed: Hoji Free 110 Alpine Touring Ski Boot - 2023
review.reviewBody:
Great weight and range of motion for the up and nice progressive flex for the way down!
The fit often takes some boot punches for most feet, but once you have the fit dialled the boot is awesome for walking and driving big skis!
review.name: Awesome range of motion on the up and skiability on the down

review.itemreviewed: Hoji Free 110 Alpine Touring Ski Boot - 2023
review.reviewBody: Just bought these boots for the upcoming BC season, very excited to use them. I’ve skied a pair of Hoji tour pro and they are also great. Walk mode is incredible and the boots are super easy to use. Feel indestructible and they’re as light as runners. Paired with the Dynafit Speed Turns.
review.name: Awesome

review.itemreviewed: Hoji Free 110 Alpine Touring Ski Boot - 2023
review.reviewBody: I bought these almost a year ago. I had to make a few minor adjustments to get them to fit. I got a tube sock filled it with rice, put it in the microwave for 7 or 8 minutes then put the sock into the boot. After about five minutes then I put my foot in and let the inner boot mold around my foot. (I found this procedure on You-Tube} I also added an insole that was made in Germany that helps keep the heat in and supports my arch. Then I tried different socks to find some the were comfortable in the boot. I used the boots mostly at ski resorts. They were very good. The Radical bindings worked very well. The Hoji Free 97 skis were excellent in powder and groomed trails. I used them a few times cross country skiing in the back country and they were excellent. We had a lot of avalanche warning days last year so I was limited in this category. I hope to do some more Free Skiing this year. Over all I was very pleased with my ski package and I would recommend them. Make sure they fit and try on both boots to make sure they are comfortable.
review.name: Swiss Army knife of ski boots.

review.itemreviewed: Hoji Free 110 Alpine Touring Ski Boot - 2023
review.reviewBody: Because I love them

review.itemreviewed: Hoji Free 110 Alpine Touring Ski Boot - 2023
review.reviewBody: Skis great with plenty of control.  Easy walking and so easy to switch between the 2.

name: Hoji Free 110 Alpine Touring Ski Boot - 2023

hasVariant.name: Grizzly Carbon Ski
hasVariant.description: Buy the Weston Grizzly Carbon Ski online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
I've been on the Grizzlies for 3 seasons now, and they're perfect for what I do. I spend most of my time skiing in Brittish Columbia, and this is my go-to. They rip in pow, but because of the camber underfoot, I find they handle all conditions, even if it gets firm and chopped up. I can ski them everyday of the season - true one ski quiver for places that get lots of snow.

I'm 5'10" and 165lb and I ski the 186cm. I tour on the carbon model, which cuts some weight and keeps the legs fresh for the descent. I've also got the standard construction, which is super damp and stable - it works great for the resort or mechanized access.

These skis have held up to a TON of abuse and I honestly can't fault them!! highly recommended.
review.name: Daily driver for BC

review.reviewBody: This ski is my daily driver, and favorite ski of all time!!! I’ve been skiing 100ish days a year for the past 2 decades and have had the good fortune of skiing just about every ski out there while working in shops, and also manufactured skis for a handful of years. This Grizzly Carbon has all of the right ingredients to be a great everyday ski for all over the mountain. Charges inbounds through crud, bumps and groomers and floats like a dream in the deepest pow! Basically Weston nailed the design on this one, and it will do anything you ask of it!!!
review.name: Grizzly Carbon

review.reviewBody: These things float in the deepest pow. Very fun and lively skis! I was nervous to ski as short as a 186, but the 120mm waist keeps you afloat no matter how deep and blower the snow is. Its a super quick turning ski with ample tip and til rocker, but plenty stiff enough underfoot to still arc turns on groomers. Buy it!
review.name: POW Skis!

review.reviewBody: This is the Ski on big days. Super light and they charge! I ride these on big mountain missions and on mega deep days. The turn radius is small and they turn on a dime because of this. So whether your in tight trees or a tight chute, open it up because these skis will keep up.
review.name: Playful pow slayer

review.reviewBody: Weston Grizzly skis not only float on that fresh powder, but they still hold an edge and cut-through any crud with NO problem. They are a must have for those DUMPING on repeat days !!!
review.name: They things FLOAT

review.reviewBody: The Grizzly is a powder hungry monster. It tours great for a 120mm underfoot and very light for its size. There is no amount of snow that slows this thing down. Its stable at speed and loves to log airtime. For those who think this thing can't handle the groomers you will be pleasantly surprised. Its multi radial sidecut makes the Grizzly act like an oversized GS ski. Highly recommend
review.name: Grizzly eats POW 4 breaky, lunch, suppah

review.reviewBody: I like to call these skis my “Landing Gears” as they have allowed me to ski out of the deepest and gnarliest landings where most skis would fold or break.  They are super lightweight for how burly and rigid they are, which makes for an even easier uphill experience.  I utilize the CAST system with heavy Pivots on these and they are still lighter than my other skis with pin bindings.  Absolute beauty of a ski and will be in my quiver as long as they make them!
review.name: RIPS

review.reviewBody: These aren't the first ski I go to because of the waist, but I know I'm going to have a good day when I do grab them! I haven't skied a pow ski that you can open up on like this, but still feels super nimble in the trees. I think it's a result of the variable sidecut, whatever it is, it works! These are surprisingly cambered for a pow ski, but are super fun and playful despite that. That camber comes in handy when you get variable snow, or groomers/cat tracks if you take them to the resort. Probably wouldn't be the only ski I owned (although I'd honestly be pretty happy if that was the case), but an incredible ski for the deeper days
review.name: Powder ski you can rail on

review.reviewBody: The grizzly has been my go to year round ski for years! It's got Great stiffness underfoot to hold an edge or ride out those flat landings. While still being insanely light for a 120mm underfoot ski. Super durable also after taking them for many early season tours and they returned with barely a scratch! The camber and rocker profile is excellent to help you hold an edge on the firmer stuff too! Get this ski!
review.name: Lightweight pow hunting machine!

review.reviewBody: The Grizzly skis great in powder! With 120mm under foot they are hard to sink. When matched with the pomoca z clip skins they are super easy to transition. These skis are even great on edge thanks to some healthy side cut!
review.name: Favorite powder touring ski

name: Grizzly Carbon Ski

review.itemreviewed: Down With It Down Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: I cannot say enough good things about this jacket. I am from Minnesota and I am cold all the time during the winter months. I've tried a number of different jackets, all from different brands. This jacket is by far the best jacket, and the warmest jacket I have ever owned. I am 5'8", 135 lbs, and a size small is snug fitting on me and that is just how I like my jackets. It's a perfect fit. I regularly wear it to run errands and go for walks in the winter. I just got done with a walk, feels like temperature was 8 degrees, winds gusting to 18 mph. This jacket kept me so warm, I was sweating when I got home! The jacket is not only very warm, but it is also 100% wind proof. I would buy this jacket again and again. I also love that the jacket is made from recycled down. I highly recommend this jacket.
review.name: Love this jacket!

review.itemreviewed: Down With It Down Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: This is my new go-to everyday winter  jacket. It's longer then I thought it would be from the photos but it fits great and is really warm.
review.name: Perfect for everyday use

review.itemreviewed: Down With It Down Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: This jacket is amazing. Super soft, warm, perfect length, and the green color is beautiful!!  It is a little heavier and feels warmer than the down hoodie or sweater. This was everything I hoped it would be!
review.name: Love Love Love

name: Down With It Down Jacket - Women's

comment: Hi there. I am sorry to hear that this didn't work as expected. We would be happy to help get this returned or exchanged for a different product! I have sent you an email to follow up.

review.reviewBody: I bought one b/c I wanted more side visibility on my commute. Turns out in daytime conditions there was virtually no side view visibility, and I wasn't impressed w/the back flash either.
review.name: Pretty Useless in Daytime

review.reviewBody: I like this light for my aero seatpost a lot more than the Specialized Stix. The mounting bracket fits the sharper edge a lot better. As for the light, not only is it bright, but you can see it on the sides. It mostly stays in place, but sometimes it slides a little sideways. That's the only reason I gave it four instead of five stars. That said, if you have an aero seatpost and need to be seen at night, this is a really good product.
review.name: Bright aero tail light...

review.reviewBody:
Over eight to ten years for two bikes, I purchased three or four NiteRider headlights and at least as many NiteRider taillights& based primarily on the tech specs. Early ones were not rechargeable, later ones rechargeable.

Now questioning, er... abandoning, my brand loyalty.

One taillight simply stopped working (Cherry Bomb), another had the clip mount crack off, and the most recent one never lived up to the charging specs out of the box and quickly got worse from there (Solas). 

I'm a pride-of-ownership kinda person, take care of my stuff, have been anything but "hard" on these lights, and they've been unsatisfactory.

Without getting into the details, let's just say my interaction with NiteRider customer support was less than satisfying. Zero, zip, nada appreciation for my loyalty.

The latest OLED headlight still works fine after two seasons. But I'd steer as far away as I could from their taillights. Longevity sucks.

I'm likely to opt for the Specialized Stix Elite 2 Taillight or the Lyzene Strip Drive Pro Tail Light to replace the latest NiteRider that broke.
review.name: NiteRider Taillights... NO

review.reviewBody: Sentry is the perfect name for this tail light.  Best rear light I've used.  Great feeling to be riding on my early morning rides knowing this light has my back.
review.name: Excellent

review.reviewBody: Terrific rear light.  Especially for long and early morning rides.
review.name: Great light.

name: Sentry Aero 260 Tail Light

review.reviewBody: Trying to figure out how to make this a helpful review for others.  The sole is a great platform for pushing power through the pedal.  The dual boa is nice.  That  being said the shoe feels very stiff and uncomfortable but that may resolve with time.  It's nice to wear a little thicker sock with gravel riding however the up and down room at the toe's is tight.  The shoe also feels tight on width even though I followed the measurements to the mm.  Good solid shoe but needs some break in time to get comfortable.  I hope.
review.name: Lake gravel

review.reviewBody:
Bought these as a mountain bike shoe, as I have several pairs of Lake road shoes, including a couple pairs of CX238. This model in Lake's lineup just fits my foot the best. Most cycling shoes, sizing differs from brand to brand, one company's 44 can be another company's 45. Most of my shoes have been size 43, with these Lakes, I needed 43.5. 

While these feel pretty much like the CX238, there is one slight difference I can see so far. The Clarino fake leather used for this shoe doesn't feel as slipper-like comfy as the real leather used in the CX shoes. It just feels a bit stiffer, less supple. Granted, these shoes are brand new, and after some miles on them, perhaps they'll break in a bit. That extra stiffness might turn out to be beneficial. Also, the Clarino used for these may not shrink or toughen up after getting soaked like real leather can, making these more suitable for offroad use.
review.name: Typical Lake quality

name: MX238 Gravel Cycling Shoe - Men's

review.reviewBody: I agree with Jon's review. The big pieces for the top and down tube are great, but the smaller pieces are garbage for cover the seat and chain stays. They don't take to curves very well and I ended up with dirt underneath all of them within the first ride. Overall the material is stout and I have no complaints with the larger pieces so if you're looking for this, stick with the cheaper kit.
review.name: Just use the large pieces

review.reviewBody:
I went with Invisiframe for my old Rocky Altitude, but wanted to try something new when I replaced it with a Pivot Switchblade. The downtube and top tube protectors are great along with the two patches for the headtube but the rest of the kit is a waste of money. The chainstay and seatstay protectors don't handle curves all that well.

Get the cheaper version without the chainstay/seatstay protectors or go full custom. I'm replacing this with RideWrap and plan on using the extra pieces on another bike for basic cable rub protection.
review.name: Get the cheaper version or a custom wrap

review.reviewBody: Great product, easy to apply, and actually adds protection compared to the frame wrap products. We have a lot of loose rock that will normally pepper your frame. When applying it helps to heat it up with a blow dryer if it is not folding around tighter areas.
review.name: Clear Honeycomb

name: Honeycomb Frame Guard XXL

review.reviewBody: Best shoes out there period. This is the only shoes that you can resolve basically infinite times and still hold up their shape. Performance wise impeccable.
review.name: It has all you need

review.reviewBody:
For whatever reason, I decided to try a different shoe…maybe I wasn’t totally thrilled with either my muiras or solutions. Did some research and these seemed like the best thing for technical sport climbing and bouldering.

I LOVE THEM.

They fit super well, and comfortable while performing strongly, and have already changed my climbing.

If you are wondering about size: I wear a 39 in LS muiras, a 39.5 in LS solutions, and a 40.5 in Scarpa vs Instincts.  Maybe could have gotten away with a half size down, but these fit super snug and perform well (I’m over the days of cramped feet).
review.name: The better equivalent to La Sportiva Solutions

review.reviewBody: I absolutely love these shoes. I purchased them as a replacement for the La Sportiva Otaki's that I had been wearing. I was looking for a shoe that was a bit softer and easier on my feet. The rubber on these Scarpa's allows for precise footwork on technical climbs (I've tested them out at both the gym and outdoors on limestone and granite). I fluctuate between a 37.5 and 39 with climbing shoes, wear a size 7.5/8 in street shoes, and found that these are snug for me in the 38.5.
review.name: Instinct VS Climbing Shoe

name: Instinct VS Climbing Shoe - Women's

review.reviewBody:
Used these on a 3 day tour, temperatures fluctuated between 45 degrees to -6 degrees F with windchill and it snowed 20” over two of the days. I wore long under wear on the cold days and boxers on the warm days, I was alway comfortable. The zippers are positioned well and operate easily without help from others.   I used suspenders and feel that they may be a good addition to these pants.  I would also add a back pocket to these pants if I could, there are only two deep front pockets. 

I really like these pants for bx skiing.  A- for lack of suspenders and no back pockets. 

I am 5’10”, 32” waist, 30” length, and 170lbs. I got the medium size
review.name: Well designed and perfect

name: Upstride Pant - Men's

review.reviewBody: I would not recommend for Presta valves; especially if you have long stems. While the pump does generate sufficient pressure,  the short neck makes it trail pumping awkward. review.reviewBody: This is my second pair of Mad Rock Remora shoes. I climb at the gym 3-5 times a week, and having a slip on that feels secure is such a treat when getting on and off the wall repeatedly.  The rubber on my old pair lasted a good while before the toes wore through, but it seemed to last a little longer than my Evolv's (or I got better at climbing, who knows?). My feet are somewhat wide and large, and I have no trouble getting in and out. Even on heel-hooks the shoes stay snug. I'm not the most advanced climber, but I would certainly recommend these to any beginner or amateur.
review.name: Comfortable and Durable

review.reviewBody:
First thing I noticed when I put on these shoes is they feel just like the Evolv Zenists I have (Pre 2024 remodel). Madrocks site says these don't have a midsole and yet they feel stiffer than the Zenists; I think due to the stiffer Madrock rubber used. My only grip is these are "so-so" at deep toe-hooks, the pull strap on the top kind of gets in the way and slides against the top of the shoe with whatever you are toe-hooking into. I'd say, unless you are looking for a good all affordable around slipper or just looking at Madrock in general, I'd recommend getting the Madrock's Rovers instead since they are even cheaper, more adjustable with the straps, and I feel perform about the same.

Other shoes I wear, Evolv Shaman & Zenists (US 10.5), Scarpa Instinct VSR (42.5), Ocun Ozone HV (US 9.5). Mad Rock Rover (US 9).
review.name: Fit like the Evolv Zenists!

review.reviewBody:
The Remoras are a great all round soft slipper, good for easy climbing, slab and even speed climbing. These ultra flexible and comfortable shoes are great for warming up and doing long easy sport routes where stickiness and reliability is a must but no need to worry about discomfort. When this slipper is brand new the edge is capable of tackling very small, delicate feet while climbing in steep terrain. The compression fit these shoes offer makes for a very reliable and comfortable fit. The toe box is great for a wide foot and the heel cup grips very well. The balance between comfort and performance is very well executed in this shoe. I find myself slipping these on when I need a chill pair of shoes to have a long session and not use a more aggressive pair. Like many of MR shoes the sticky rubber, especially on such a soft shoe, is really unparalleled on small feet outside. The edge of the shoe is stiff enough to stand on small edges, yet soft enough to feel exactly what you’re stepping on. The toe box has a solid layer of rubber on the top that is good for toe hooks, while also being malleable enough to get into toe jambs and slots. These are great shoes for everything from being a first pair of climbing shoes to the seasoned climber looking for a specialty slipper. 
Mad Rock Ambassador 
Alex A.
review.name: Great slippers!

review.reviewBody: Love the shoes, but he sole delaminated after less than a month
review.name: Durability an issue

name: Remora HV Climbing Shoe

review.reviewBody: This is a heavy jacket until you put it on. It felt like my body melted into the feathers and took away any possibility of cold to creep in. Sleeve length is perfect, longer body keeps cold out and does not ride up. Plaid flannel lining is welcoming and warm. I am a square-bodied semi-busty female in my 70's. I LOVE this coat. Can't wait for fall and winter to really break it in.
review.name: Cozy Warm Wonderful

review.reviewBody: This jacket is amazing! It’s super plush and warm. The corduroy is excellent quality and pockets are really deep to hold any size phone. If you don’t like compliments, this jacket is not for you. People stop me on the daily to ask me about this gem!! So happy I got it❤️
review.name: My new favorite jacket

review.reviewBody: Like the title states, this coat is the best down coat I have ever owned. I wish it was cold all year round just so I can walk around in this coat all day.
review.name: Best Down Coat I've ever owned.

review.itemreviewed: Lightning Lift III Jacket - Toddler Boys'
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Fits right, nice and warm, and waterproof. Perfect for New England winters and learning to ski
review.name: Nice jacket

review.itemreviewed: Lightning Lift III Jacket - Toddler Boys'
review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I have a very opinionated almost 4 year old, and this jacket fits all his criteria of being acceptable to wear, so that’s a win! He like the two outer pockets that zip, the red color with the stripe and the added “secret” interior pocket- perfect size for a Lego character. 
I like the quality, and the size seems spot on. It seems a little thin, but I’m putting my trust into the temp ratings on the coat, and trying to trust newer warmth tech. Overall, satisfied with this jacket and would recommend .
review.name: It’s a “YES” from an opinionated toddler

review.itemreviewed: Lightning Lift III Jacket - Toddler Boys'
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Bought the jacket for my 4 year old son so he can use it again next year. Jacket is just what I expected when reading the description. Fits a little big.
review.name: Great jacket for the price

review.reviewBody: I’m a new climber and wanted some affordable climbing shoes to get started with. These have been great so far and have helped improved my climbing!
review.name: Great beginner climbing shoes

review.reviewBody:
Unfortunately, this fit is not for me. I am a size 6, but the heel is much larger than my heel so it makes it a tight fit for my toes. I can’t wear a size 6 1/2 because the heel is much larger therefore creating an even bigger gap there, but my toes are okay. I got the size 6 and hoped it would feel better after I broke it in. But no. 
I am new to climbing and these had the best specs and reviews for what I am seeking so maybe I just have a smaller heel than most people. I’m bummed. I love the style of the shoe.
review.name: Great shoe. Not for me.

review.reviewBody: I’m a new climber but these shoes have been great for my foray into indoor bouldering! Super comfortable, streamlined design and quick on/off.

review.itemreviewed: Fitz Roy Down Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: Not up to the usual Patagonia quality.  800 down fill not what it used to be.
review.name: Not warm and doesn't fit right

review.itemreviewed: Fitz Roy Down Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I purchased the Fitz Roy jacket in hopes that it would meet my needs for shoulder-season river trips where the night temps can drop into the 20's-30's. The jacket fit well with a fuller cut to allow for layering and the sleeve and body length were perfect. The down fill is a step up from their Down Sweater Hoody which I own, but still lighter than my Rab Neutrino, which I was hoping to replace. But with layering it would have met my needs.

The issue I found was with the design of the hood and the single-pull drawcord for adjustment. Fully zipped up, the collar came to the bottom of my chin. With the hood on there was a lot of open space around my face and neck because the opening is so large. Using the single-pull drawcord, I can get the hood snug around my face and chin but then the tension of the drawcord circling around the top of my head is uncomfortably tight. This isn't the case with my Down Sweater Hoody where the hood fits snugly over my chin and around my face when zipped up with only a small amount of tension on the drawcord. 

If there wasn't an issue with the hood design I would give this a 5-star rating. I expect more from Patagonia when designing functional outdoor gear.
review.name: Poor hood design
comment: The Fitz Roy has a hood designed to fit a helmet. So, it doesn't really deserve a lower rating for doing what it's suppose to do.

review.itemreviewed: Fitz Roy Down Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I was looking for a jacket to fill the gap between the down sweater hoody and a full-on stand alone down parka.   Upon inspection I can see this jacket will fill this spot perfectly - its just heavy enough to add real insulation under a shell or even be stand-alone with a decent layer below. 

Really like the chest pockets as they are well designed for a phone or GPS. 

I am 6'3 and 175 and I like the XL as it has plenty of room below should I layer and the arms are plenty long.
review.name: Perfect Midweight Puff

review.reviewBody: Excellent waterproof, insulated layer! Great piece of gear to keep you insulated even when wet. Love there are pit zips to let heat escape where needed. Plenty of zippered pockets. Overall excellent jacket and warm.
review.name: Really happy with this waterproof insulated jacket.

review.reviewBody: Love that this coat is actually waterproof and doesn’t absorb the water! You can just see it beading off. I have a hard time finding coats with a big enough hood, and this one is perfect. I do with there were some draw strings or cords to synch the hood closer, and I wish the sleeves were a bit wider so I could layer thicker, but the coat has nice features like the side vents and front pocket, and I love it. I’m 5’7” 160lbs and I got a L, fits great.
review.name: Pretty darn good

review.reviewBody: Exactly what I was looking for for a hiking trip. Perfect for layering with a down sweater underneath and a few more layers. I am 5'3 and 92 lbs and the XS fits me great with room for that additional jacket/sweater or two.
review.name: Great jacket great price

review.reviewBody: I have broad shoulders and a large bosom (36G) that are hard to fit in most women’s jacket but I took a chance and bought this jacket and I am so glad I did! I purchased an XL. The fit is perfect, I appreciate being able to adjust the sleeve opening and the hood. It’s not tight in the chest or shoulders which gives me room to move  while snowshoeing and nordic skiing.
review.name: Just Right!

review.reviewBody: I am 5'9" and the sleeves of the XL are shorter than a Jockey midlayer in XL, shorter than Eddie Bauer XL, and shorter than my Columbia 3-in-1 coat XL.  The front zipper has small teeth, it's a one-way zipper and it feels flimsy.  If they use a waterproof layer, I wish they would have chosen a more durable zipper or at least a zipper that is easier to grasp.  The front zipper is the same (pull size, teeth) as the chest pocket zipper, if that gives you an idea of what I mean.  It is warm.  It fits a bit trim and I wear a 38B which is small-chested, but this is too tight across the chest. I really like that it has down insulation, and a durable outer layer. I think this means feathers won't stick out, and it's more durable for an active person.  I bought it based on the other review saying it's a great daily coat. I don't think the zipper will last. The coat doesn't add much bulk--so it's aesthetically nice for that reason.
review.name: Not very long arms, small tooth zipper

review.reviewBody: This is THE jacket to have as a daily fall through spring daily driver for your day to day errands. There’s details like Velcro cuffs to further fine tune fit around gloves, pit zips, and internal pockets. And the synth green is just gorgeous in person. The fit is the classic MH fit and I would even venture to say even a little roomier in the chest area- and being a 38DD that’s saying something! I ordered my typical size and appreciate the extra bit of room for layering or sweaters. The jacket length is absolutely perfect and I’m a longer torsoed lady, no drafty lower back here. This is the first piece in a year or so that I’ve found from MH that they truly knocked it out of the park. The single only nitpick I could have is a lack of hood drawcords to cinch down the hood further. The only hood adjustment is at the back of the hood which cinches down the crown. If you’re on the fence, this is a very very solid buy.
review.name: My New Favorite Daily Driver

review.itemreviewed: Benton Springs Novelty Hooded Fleece Jacket - Girls'
review.reviewBody: This jacket is oddly cut. I got an XS and a S for my 6yo and 8yo and, while they seem to be the correct size (fit well in sleeve length and around the chest and shoulders), they fit strangely.  It is unusually short from the armpit to the hem of the jacket.  I could see this even before trying them on my girls. If anything, a jacket should be slightly long in the body, not noticeably too short! When the hood is up and the jacket is zipped all the way up, it comes halfway up their faces, not merely to the chin as you would expect.  It's like the designers didn't test it on a real kid. I got the comparable boy jacket (Steens Mt. II) for my 4yo son and it does not have these two issues; it is well proportioned. Super disappointed.
review.name: Oddly cut
comment: Hey there! We are really sorry the fit didn't hit the mark for you and your child. We would love to assist with finding something that works better. Please feel free to reach out to our Customer Care team if you need further assistance

name: Benton Springs Novelty Hooded Fleece Jacket - Girls'

review.itemreviewed: Trail 2650 GTX Mid Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: I got these boots for I needed water resistant shoes for work. These puppies are comfortable wearing all day. Water doesn't get to my feet and I wear shorts everyday in FL. Came in with a lace messed up. For the price I wasn't happy. Danner sent me new laces massively fast! Good boots and they stand behind their product. Would definitely buy again.

review.itemreviewed: Trail 2650 GTX Mid Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: The sizing on this model runs small.  The toe box is too tight and the width feels narrower than a normal width.  I have the low rise version of the Trail 2650 and it's my go to shoe in the summer.  Maybe it's the gortex.
review.name: Sizing too small

review.itemreviewed: Trail 2650 GTX Mid Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: buy it 1/2 to 1 size larger than your usual size... it runs small and narrow

review.itemreviewed: Trail 2650 GTX Mid Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: I?m usually a 12. Tried on the 12 but it was tight which didn?t seem like a good idea for hiking boots. I bought the 13 instead. There?s wiggle room now and feels much better. And now I?ve got room for thicker hiking socks. These boots seem to have some extra volume so thicker socks are probably a good idea. I really like the look. Very lightweight. Traction is super aggressive. So far, so good!

review.reviewBody: I only tried these on so this is the shortest term review. These have reasonable room for people with wider feet like me and are very breathable but they are not very stiff for a bike shoe, and especially the heel of the shoe is soft, with a totally flat sole(no "rocker" at all) which causes the cuff to bend in a very uncomfortable way when one walks - I bet they would be okay for pedaling but I can't bother to try them any further.
review.name: Only tried on

review.reviewBody: Love the Ion Scrub Amp shoe. Compared to other shoes I?ve loved before, this shoe is only slightly less stiff in the sole (8 out of 10). It sticks to the pedal better than those previous shoes. The Ion hugs your foot and is extremely comfortable for longer rides or lounging post-ride, while drinking a beverage at a socially safe distance with your crew. I?ve done the dreaded hike-a-bike up some steep rock faces and wasn?t at all concerned about slipping, as the sole gives enough feedback to know what?s going on at all times, on and off the pedal. This is by far my current go-to shoe for mountain biking in any conditions.
review.name: Snug and solid

name: Scrub AMP Cycling Shoe - Men's

That being said, all summer I've been eyeing the women's version...not only do I like the color, but I REALLY like the addition of a bigger basket...great addition! The only tough thing was switching out the basket, but I guess that speaks to their durability. I love how lightweight and durable these poles are. I 10/10 recommend these poles!

They have an easy swing weight and, as a backpacker, being able to adjust the height up for stream crossings gives me the added balance assist with weight on my back.

review.reviewBody: Bought this a month ago and it is a comfortable bib made with high quality materials. It has a thick chamois pad and tons of pockets for gear, food, drinks for long rides. I guess its for domestiques! Love this bib.
review.name: Solid bib

review.reviewBody: I have been cycling for about 5years now, and have — up until this point — worn shorts and bibs from lower priced companies that sell exclusively through large e-commerce sites. While very comfortable, most of the products used lower quality fabric that was prone to fraying.  After reading various reviews that praised the quality of products from RAPHA, I took the plunge on these bib shorts, and paid (even with the discount from Competitive Cyclist, thank you) about three times what I had paid for similar products I purchased previously (from companies that, perhaps, didn’t have as effective of a PR department as Rapha!). First of all, re: the sizing, their size chart seems to be way off…I’m 6’1” and 170 lbs, with a 41” chest, so initially bought a L, per their size chart. I could barely get the item on…I might have had better luck with a gallon of paint and a brush!  So, returned them and got the XL. It fits, but somewhat oddly: the bibs seem to be for a very short-waisted, long legged individual. The shoulder straps seem to be short, and the inseam long. The quality of the product does seem to be superior, especially the fabric itself and the sewing. The pockets are a little lower on the leg than I would like, but not terrible and sized well for my iPhone 15 ProMax. I find the pockets on the back of the bibs to be impractical for anything you might need quick access to, as they are covered by the jersey that I wear. Nonetheless, they could be useful for storage of items needed on an occasional basis during a ride. My real issue with with the bib shorts is the quality of the chamois/padding. First of all, the pad seems smaller in overall area than that which I’ve experienced previously from other brands. Additionally, it is not plush whatsoever. The combination of both of these deficiencies result in a less comfortable ride than I have experienced with the bib shorts I’ve purchased previously for 1/3 the price. What I’d really like to see is a larger, more plush padding with the quality of the fabric and the sewing that is displayed in this product. I’m willing to consider that the padding may just be a bad fit for my particular anatomic build , so if you are willing to roll the dice on that, I do recommend the product for its specific fabric quality. However, I learned a valuable lesson here. The MOST important aspect of any cycling  apparel is its comfort and practicality during the ride. Appearance, including some fraying, is not as critical. So, my overall impression with the RAPHA Core Cargo Bib Short could be summed up in the word “disappointed “and in the phrase “didn’t live up to expectations.”
review.name: Fit/comfort doesn’t match the hype

review.reviewBody: I absolutely love these bibs. the pockets are an icing on the cake.
review.name: Excellent bibs

review.reviewBody: First time trying Rapha. Chamios is just okay. Won't be grabbing these for anything more than a 1-2 hour ride. Expected more with how many people wear Rapha, I suppose the Pro line is where it's at...fit was good. 6'2'' ~195 lbs size Large
review.name: Meh

review.reviewBody: Had made the comment a number of years ago that bib shorts would be better with some storage. Great to see the merge of bibs and yoga pant functionality at last.
review.name: Cargo

Nice, warm jacket. Good looking. Works well for 20-55 degree weather. One flaw: there's no wind blocker fabric behind the front zipper. Very odd, as the chin section has it, but it stops at the neck going down. It's noticeable on cold days and requires a scarf or something underneath.

review.reviewBody:
I paid about $60 for this coat.  At that price it’s a decent jacket.  At it’s list price of $110, you may as well spend a bit more and get a good one.  

This coat is well made, looks great, and fits excellent.  It is however made from lower grade materials.  My comparison, and the coat I am trying to replace, is an Arcteryx Atom LT hoodie.  Mine sadly is no longer presentable after about 10 years of use, and A, changed their fit so significantly (I changed shape as well) that I no longer fit their clothes.  For reference I’m 5’7” and about 195 pounds.  Very athletic, but as a POC, I have a rump, and big chest - most mountain gear is made for tall white guys or people who look like models - which I am not.

This coat is best described as a coffee and dog walk jacket rather than something you’d trust your life to in a mountaineering situation.  I wore it on a longish 6 mile hike, on a rainy 50 degree day, through a valley and over a ridge with pretty varied micro climates.  I’d say it’s main weakness is breathability.  I think as much sweat was trapped inside as water that seeped through the DWR coating - which lasted about 5 min before it stopped beading and started seeping.  It’s insulation is also poor quality weight ratio.  I ordered a Cotopaxi coat at the same time, and though it didn’t fit, it was clear that though thinner and much lighter, it was warmer. This coat proved good at stopping wind, and did not get too cold even when wet.  

All in all, I appreciate the coat for it’s value.  It’s nice looking.  It’s well built.  It has nice lining in the pockets to keep your hands warm.  It’s windproof and cosy.  And at $60 a decent value.

A couple of improvements might include a different lining material that breathes better, and possibly another material down the sides or in the pit area that allows for some heat to escape.  The hood could use a draw string (though it works surprisingly well) and it needs a coat hook loop (the absence or which is pretty annoying).  Again, for $60, I’d recommend it to most, as long as your not looking for true mount gear.
review.name: Decent Jacket - for the $

name: Venture Insulated Hoodie - Men's

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I absolutely LOVE this tote!!!! ❤️ It is super light yet durable. It's waterproof and too easy to store. It is very sturdy and can handle moderately heavy loads and I use it for EVERYTHING. I've used it to carry grocery items from my car into the house, I've used it in my garden to carry/transfer my plants around the yard and I've even used it to soak my feet a couple of times in my bedroom! It is SUPER versatile because I've definitely found several uses for it. When I'm finished I can easily clean it, dry it, collapse it, then slide it into a discreet spot, whether it's under a bed, on a closet shelf or in the trunk space of my vehicle. It's honestly amazing and I definitely plan to add more to my collection! I NEED MORE OF THESE! 10/10 would definitely recommend!
review.name: Super Durable, Versatile and Easy to Store!!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love the versatility and portability of this product! It folds flat for easy storage when not using. It’s super spacious when expanded and fits a TON of things. The material is durable too so you don’t have to worry about it breaking. I’ve used it to move things around my house and also for a beach day. It’s super versatile and can be used for many different reasons and scenarios. Super handy item to have and the footprint is small.
review.name: Versatile product to have handy

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is probably one of my favorite things I’ve gotten to review. This tote is amazing. The size is perfect, not too large but still holds what you need it to. The tote is a mix between rubber and hard plastic so it’s easy to clean and weather ready! The fact that I can collapse it when I don’t need the fill tote was a game changer. We use this all the time since we have received!!
review.name: Best tote ever!!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This bin has been a great multipurpose addition! It folds down nice and flat for storage, but it's easy to pop out and load up with stuff. It's quite sturdy and easy to carry. So far I haven't had the occasion to use this for camping, but I use it every time I get groceries to help carry stuff up to my 3rd floor walk-up. My only complaint is that, while it holds plenty of stuff, due to the design it is much narrower at the base and makes it a little harder to properly load things. I would have preferred it to be wider and less deep.
review.name: Great multipurpose bin!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] It’s a super versatile and durable item! I love using it to store stuff going in and out of the car. Perfect for kids toys, groceries and misc things that you have. It’s easy to use and super compact since it’s collapsible.
review.name: Amazing! A must have

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] It is very good quality rubberish material & it slims down very nicely. Easy to pull up to make a tub. Great for a grocery run & sometime I use it to soak clothes in.
review.name: Versatile product

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This collapsible tote is great for camping. It's great for carrying stuff to your table and storing stuff in. It it also good to use when you need to wash your camp dishes if you have access to water.  I love that it collapes down, which makes it easy to store when not in use. The material is a durable silicone, and as long as it is taken care of, it should last you a very long time. This tote would also be good to keep in your vehicle to store things in or to have a tote to carry groceries into your house.
review.name: Great for camping

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love this bin! It’s collapsible for easy storage. You can also only lift it up a little if you don’t need the full bin size. Easy to use and clean. Durable.
review.name: Durable!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Very durable and great for camping or anything for storage. I can make it compact to very portable and the material is a heavy rubber. Absolutely love it and it's huge.
review.name: Great for storage

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This gear tote surprised me with its capabilities, it completely flattens which makes it easy to store and carry around and then it opens up to this huge spacious container to put everything I need and more when going camping or fishing, it’s great! The material seems very durable and I love the strong grip it has on the four bottoms of it, definitely recommend
review.name: Great additions for camping!

review.reviewBody: I purchased this jacket in Navy blue in 2022 and it has been great. I am 5 ft 4 in and 118 lbs when I bought it the small was still comfortable with a sweatshirt under when I was 128 lbs last winter. My Navy coat gets dirty looking easily from dust or hay but it looks great and feels great. It moves well for riding. I never feel bound by the coat I have used this coat at 10-50 degrees but I used a different coat when it was really cold (under 30) and I was going to be outside all day so this one could stay looking nice. I am anxious to try it in Tan so the dirt may not show as well.
review.name: Nice fit. True to size. Arms move well riding.

review.reviewBody: I like this jacket a lot, it was a bit heavy feeling, and it was too snug, even though my normal size. So I had to return it.
review.name: Good utility jacket

review.reviewBody: Zipper is tough! Will not insert all the way to continue to zip or pull up.
review.name: Zipper
comment: Hello Sharon, we value your honest feedback. We’re sorry to hear of your disappointment with the zipper on this jacket. Please be on the lookout for an email from us where we can further discuss this issue. We’re here to help!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This jacket is tough, comfortable and looks great. Easy to ride in and wear just about anywhere. Love the material. Fits true to size.
review.name: Great all around jacket

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Extremely warm, but also quite light in weight and very flexible so it is comfortable to work and ride in. Standard Ariat sizing.
review.name: Excellent winter jacket

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Overall high-quality jacket! Very warm and comfortable, not too bulky, and very stylish.
review.name: Stylish, High-Quality Jacket

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Let me start by saying that this coat is not great for barn chores because it does show dirt very easily, and does not dust off quite as nice as I would like but that is it’s only negative. I love it for wearing to town and church and it looks great in the saddle both English and western, it is warm enough by itself for 30° days but I would pair it with a puffer coat under for negatives or windy days. I bought a medium and it was too large went back and traded it for a small for 120 pounds 5’5”. Great range of motion for riding a horse or skiing.
review.name: I love this coat!

review.reviewBody: This jacket is one of the best purchases I’ve made all year! I absolutely love the color and fit. I’m tall with long arms and average build and it’s perfect in every way. The color is dark enough to hide dirt but the blue is a nice change from neutrals and black. It’s so well made and tailored that though I use it in the barn regularly, I can pop it in the wash and wear it out too. My only “complaint” is that the zipper can be a bit finicky sometimes to get started. Other than that, I’d buy another one if they had a different color.
review.name: Go To Jacket

review.reviewBody: The design of this jacket is awesome. The Navy Heather color is even better in person. I ride, but I purchased this as a casual coat to wear as a Fall/Winter/Early Spring alternative to some of my ski-type jackets. Unfortunately, the size Small felt too voluminous in the sleeves, especially the forearms. I wear SM in Aritek shirts for reference and I found this true to size otherwise. The main pictures make the jacket appear a bit more tailored. I think the photo of the women out in the field with layers is a more accurate representation. Good for layering, freedom of movement, etc. If on the fence, I would order it to see if the fit works for your needs.
review.name: Beautifully Designed Jacket

review.reviewBody: This jacket is so comfortable.  Not at all binding or restraining but lightweight and super warm and weather ready! So glad I have this...  it is my new favorite thing to wear.
review.name: Best Jacket I have ever purchased.

description: Buy the MSR Ultralight Kitchen Set online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Ultralight Kitchen Set
hasVariant.description: Buy the MSR Ultralight Kitchen Set online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Probably shouldn't write this as I didn't buy the whole kit, but I bought each piece and assemble the same kit over time. Everything works great and has held up for years of camping. I ended up with the deluxe cutting board, because it is wider (about twice as wide), but often used it in the closed position. I also have the alpine strainer, which works extremely well with veges and noodles. I also added the Alpine dish brush/scraper which comes in the larger MSR Alpine Deluxe Kitchen set. I carry my own knife, which has a cork screw, so this works great for me. If I was buying again, it would be this set.
review.name: Excellent tools

review.reviewBody: Tidy, convenient, and perfect for backpacking in. The utensils are very light weight so you won't be able to pry heavy things around in the pan with them but I had no trouble moving ground elk around in the pan and flipping trout. Saw some other reviews about them melting and not being strong but I strongly think that was user error. They're plastic so yeah, they will melt if you get them too hot. It's science. But if you don't expose them to high heat for long periods of time they work just fine.
review.name: Super convenient

review.reviewBody: Great solo kit for backcountry adventures, quick shore lunches when fishing. Always in the car and ready for adventure. Bought it for my son.
review.name: I am purchasing another one for myself.

review.reviewBody: Excellent camp kitchen set. Super light weight. Doesn't damage the no stick coating on my pans. Easy to clean. Very pleased.
review.name: Excellent addition

review.reviewBody: Super lightweight, foldable so it takes only little space. Just what you need!
review.name: Smart kitchen ware

review.reviewBody: First time I used it, it melt. You can only use it on warm or cold temperature. We contact the companie and they do not want to help us. Next time, I will buy one made of sylicon, not nylon!
review.name: Melt, only for cold or warm temperature

review.reviewBody: It's well put together and works very well. Enough extra space in the bag for extra spices and kitchen tools.
review.name: excellent kit.

review.reviewBody: First use saw the spatula melt/disform [on the first pancake!!!] while making pancakes in Southeast alaska on an Alpine SS frying pan. Wouldn't recommend and definitely would never use again. Went into the trash when we got home. Why not make a small metal spatula for the stainless steel/titanium pans/cast iron users out there? Ultimately not very stable. While the collapsible handles make folding a breeze the handles themselves are not very sturdy. This leads any normal cook to hold the device closer to the head which inadvertently squeezes the handle causing it to release. The strainer is beyond pointless, why not use a lid, ladle or spatula and save the extra weight? Further it is not sturdy, nor large enough, to withstand pasta for three people. Spice shaker holds enough spice for 1-2 meals for 1-2 people. Beyond that it's outmatched. Cutting board was fantastic to have along however I will be modifying it to fit inside one of my pot lids to: give it support, have some sort of a lip to hold things when they go flying off after you've cut them. We used them almost exclusively for cutting carrots and while it shows knife marks I would expect that.
review.name: Unimpressed - Does the Job

review.reviewBody: Minimalist set for those looking to keep it simple and quick. If you're not too picky about condiments and toppings, seasonings and salts...then this set is for you. The spatula and spoon are two simple, yet crucial elements of any cookset, and the durability of the two in this set is awesome. They are both light, yet rigid and do their job with ease. Great value as well. Recommend for quick travelers who are traveling solo.
review.name: Light and Easy

name: Ultralight Kitchen Set

review.itemreviewed: Speedcross 6 GORE-TEX Blue Fire Trail Running Shoe
review.reviewBody: Absolutely love these runners!!  The fit was spot on and enough room for my orthotics once I removed the insole.  I live in the country so every road is a trail and every view and vista is an immediate bushwack up the side of the hill.  The grip is spectacular and the stability is excellent, especially when trekking sideways along a steep hill.  I took two pair of Speedcross runners on my trek around Mont Blanc.  I wouldn't buy anything else!!
review.name: Rocking the Speedcross 6!

review.itemreviewed: Speedcross 6 GORE-TEX Blue Fire Trail Running Shoe
review.reviewBody: Great product. Feels very comfortable. I suggest this product highly!!
review.name: Amazing Shoe For Walking Trails.

review.itemreviewed: Speedcross 6 GORE-TEX Blue Fire Trail Running Shoe
review.reviewBody: When putting these on your feet, the tongue folders over all the way down, making you have to try and flatten and unfold it with your finger, which is difficult to reach all the way down, which peels back the sling at your finger nail.  After using speed cross for the last 8+years or so, it is very disappointing they are so difficult to put on now, especially at this price! Super comfy once you have got them on.
review.name: Not as good as they were.
comment: Hello! Thanks for your comment! We will contact you shortly to discuss your experience.

review.itemreviewed: Speedcross 6 GORE-TEX Blue Fire Trail Running Shoe
review.reviewBody: I've brought Salomon trainers for some years now and wouldn't have any other brand now.
review.name: Great quality

review.itemreviewed: Speedcross 6 GORE-TEX Blue Fire Trail Running Shoe
review.reviewBody: I have had various types of Speedcross and some other styles.  These are comfortable and have a thick springy heel which is ideal for dog agility. I have walked in them with the dogs to break them in and used them for short bursts of speed and manoeuverability in the ring.  I haven't had them long so haven't fully tested the waterproof abilities yet!
review.name: Comfortable and stylish

review.itemreviewed: Speedcross 6 GORE-TEX Blue Fire Trail Running Shoe
review.reviewBody: This was the first unisex shoe I've purchased and the fit and feel is spot on.  Excellent waterproof shoe, the only time my feet got wet was when the water was deep and went over the the top of the shoe.  Will buy again.
review.name: Great waterproof shoe

review.itemreviewed: Speedcross 6 GORE-TEX Blue Fire Trail Running Shoe
review.reviewBody: I have had fusion surgeries on my right and left feet. These shoes are by far the best for support while playing golf.
review.name: Perfect for golf

review.itemreviewed: Speedcross 6 GORE-TEX Blue Fire Trail Running Shoe
review.reviewBody: Bought it 2 weeks ago. When I used to walk early in the morning ( see the photo )  I used to have my socks and feet due to wet grass but so far it worked perfectly and very comfortable as well.
review.name: Good shoes for rocky and wet terrain.

review.itemreviewed: Speedcross 6 GORE-TEX Blue Fire Trail Running Shoe
review.reviewBody: It my first 15k I'm running through mud and hills. I have been running on these shoes for about 4 weeks and my feet don't hurt. I would recommend getting a pair
review.name: Great running shoe

review.itemreviewed: Speedcross 6 GORE-TEX Blue Fire Trail Running Shoe
review.reviewBody: I love these Salomon speedcross shoes! I have been wearing them for a few yrs. and some yrs I have liked more than orhers but the 6s rank at the top!
review.name: My favorite

name: Speedcross 6 GORE-TEX Blue Fire Trail Running Shoe

review.reviewBody: As a parent, finding the perfect pair of shoes for my child can often be a challenge. Kids are constantly on the move—running, jumping, and playing—and they need footwear that offers comfort, durability, and style.
review.name: Comfortable

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Size was not true to fit compared to other brands.
review.name: size untrue

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The shoe itself is great, my son mountain bikes a lot and they’ve held up well. My biggest complaint is the sizing is completely off, you need to order a much larger size than your child actually wears. The past two pairs we’ve bought we’ve needed to go two sizes up from the normal Adidas running shoe my son wears. My son wears a size 3 in normal Adidas shoes but wears an 5.5 in these shoes.  Aside from the sizing issue, great shoe.
review.name: Sizing issues but good shoe

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These are the best MTB shoes for kids. The grip on the pedals that you get from these is amazing. My kiddo would always slip on her pedals as soon as the trail would get a little rocky and bumpy. It’s the last thing you want for them to lose confidence because of lack grip. Not to mention it’s dangerous. These things absolutely solved that issue for my kiddo. Well, these shoes plus better pedals.
review.name: Best MTB shoes for kids

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These have stood up well and have been a great MTB shoe for my daughter.

review.name: Indestructible  trainers for a 5yr old!

review.reviewBody: I have worn many pairs of this shoe over many years. It continues to be a comfortable shoe for easy climbing, scrambling, and hanging out. I will definitely continue to wear it in the future.
review.name: Comfy and durable

review.reviewBody: Best shoes I’ve ever owned.  I’ve had them for 3 years and have walked to many crags and they are still going strong.
review.name: Perfect approach shoes

review.reviewBody: The shoes are great! BUT for the love of all that’s good in the world please change the colour. I daily these shoes and nobody wants to wear an orange shoe everyday.
review.name: Why are they still orange

review.reviewBody: Solid shoe, been wearing La Sportiva for years in 45.5. These are definitely a little smaller than normal length.
review.name: Great for narrow feet, but short.

review.reviewBody: I live in CO and spend time in the Gore Range which has a lot of gnarly ridges and approaches. Lightweight approach shoes don't work for me. This shoe does what it is advertised to do. There is great support all around and it is a burly shoe, but not a cluncky old-school feeling. Sensitive enough to handle class 4 or 5 climbing. Like the sole and rubber is sticky, and yes it handles wet rock very well. I can manage smaller snow sections that don't require crampons. They don't breathe well with leather tongue but in the mountains that shouldn't be a problem, and it stays in place without flopping to one side. Once the laces are adjusted and tied they are set and don't need constant adjustment, like the lacing wrapping around the back of the ankle. Shoes will need a longer break-in time so wear them around town a little before heading up. One minor complaint is the rubber rand fully wraps around the shoe and this offers a lot of protection, but it is thin in the toe. It should be thicker in my opinion in the evolution of this shoe. Overall, nice work LaSportiva!
review.name: Scrambling and Rough Terrain

review.reviewBody: I've only had these for 2 months and the right shoe is already falling apart. La Sportiva has been a disappointment the last few items I've purchased.
review.name: 2 Month Review

review.reviewBody: I have had this shoe a while.  I actually have a lot of different shoes as I am one of those people that constantly look for something better.  I am not sure there is anything better if you want good grip and protection, especially protection.  If you are going to be on your feet for very long or on a lot of rough terrain getting to that technical climb, these shoes are worth their weight in spades.  My only complaint is that I would like to see some of the colors they have in Europe!
review.name: Worth its Weight

review.reviewBody: I've had 4-5 pairs of these over the years and worn them until the soles are worn through.  They are so comfortable (once broken in) I wear them for work or play.  I've bought a pair for my 3 adult children and they all like them for hiking.
review.name: Super Support & Grip

review.reviewBody: I love Sportiva and these are great shoes EXCEPT for the lace design which fails quickly if you jam any cracks and is a nightmare to try and repair. Bring back the Exum!
review.name: Bad lace design

review.reviewBody: Upon first trying the Boulder X,  the comfort and stability provided is near perfect. While the shoe is a little heavy for long vertical approaches, they exceed in durability and lasting long hard treks on approach to the crag. I would wholeheartedly recommend these to anyone looking for an approach shoe to provide stability on longer hikes.
review.name: Sturdy and Rugged

name: Boulder X Approach Shoe - Men's

review.reviewBody: Bought month ago, too large , ordered small size from another site
review.name: Runs large, got size smaller

review.reviewBody:
Haven't it out on the trails yet, as it has been raining very hard, but this shoe fits me perfectly and seems to be very well built.
However, I was originally told it was supposed to arrive on a Tuesday, and it got delayed three times to the same Friday. Sucks because I was planning to ride with it Thursday
review.name: Amazing Shoe

review.reviewBody: I'm a bit of a novice cyclist and have been slowly curating my collection of gear over time (as it is extremely expensive). I finally decided to buy nicer shoes. I wear these for road cycling because I feel like the mountain biking shoes are typically more comfortable. They worked perfectly with my spd clip ins and I didn't experience any hot spots on my first ride. I don't have much experience with shoes though, my first and only pair has been a cheap $40 set off Amazon. Sizing seemed pretty true, I'm typically a 9 in most brands and a 40 fit perfectly. If you don't want to spend $$$ on a shoe but want a nice sturdy option, these are great. I also love the color/rubber trekking on the bottoms! Again, I use them for road cycling so I can't speak for how they hold up on a trail.
review.name: Solid shoe!

review.reviewBody:
For the price, I think these are great. The three straps allow a good range of adjustability and helps to reduce pressure points when tightening. I've tried Shimano, Fizik, and Pearl Izumi clipless shoes, and found that all of them pinched across the top of my foot at the toes. But Specialized seem to have the right amount of width that the upper is not pinched inward when tightening. The velcro is strong, and a lot faster to get on and tight than Boa systems.

The bolt holes are well positioned slightly inward of centre, and there are clear markings that make it easy setting up the same cleat position and angle on both shoes. The sole feels sufficiently stiff that I don't notice any flex on landings etc.
review.name: Excellent budget shoe

review.reviewBody:
For context, I have a narrow flat foot and weigh close to 160 with gear.  This is pretty good for a budget shoe.  For me, at this price point, I'm not going to get that glove like fit of some of the $200 and up shoes (remember - narrow foot).  

I like Specialized's body geometry thinking that went into the sole of the shoe - it means that I don't have to put a special insole in the shoe to get proper knee motion.  They give it a "6" on the stiffness meter, which works just  fine for me.  I have used stiffer shoes, but I'm happy with a 6.  If you're more on the Clydesdale side, then you might need something a bit stiffer if you're looking to transfer that 300 plus watts to the pedals.  The uppers are comfortable, but on my narrow foot, they tend to bunch up a bit near the toes when the straps are tightened.  If your foot is higher volume, you probably won't have a problem.  

The shoes are also reasonably light considering that the sole has some nice size lugs.  I have not gotten them wet so far, but the uppers seem to be made of a fast drying material.   I used the size chart provided by Specialized here on the Backcountry website, and it was spot on for me.  A European size 45 is equivalent to an 11.5 US size in this shoe, so yeah, it runs about a half size large compared to some other shoes.  If you're looking for a XC or gravel shoe that won't break the bank, yet has some nice design features, this could be the one.  When I can afford a more expensive pair of shoes, I will definitely consider the Specialized lineup.
review.name: Nice budget level shoe

review.reviewBody: First pair of Specialized shoes... just bought a Specialized bike and these match it perfectly!  They ran big.. had to return my first pair and got a 42 I wear a size 10 sometimes 11  shoe.  But these fit great and I took them out today and they were great!   Matched my bike perfectly!
review.name: I look cool! Lol

name: Recon 1.0 Mountain Bike Shoe
